Definition:Â  Foreign Jurisdiction
The term
foreign jurisdiction
refers to any geographic area other than that of the
states, territories, and possessions of the U.S.A.
District of Columbia
Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and
Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, Chapter 3, Section B - Biological Children, Adopted Children, and Stepchildren
